Logan (Wolverine).Action: Running at inhuman speed and evading a larger, faster pursuer (Sabretooth) in a natural mountain environment.
Survives a brutal fight with Sabertooth, fights fiercely to escape and defend himself.
Remains calm and does not panic despite being trapped under ice and attacked by enemies, showing resilience and controlled behavior.
Succumbs to unconsciousness or incapacitation after the intense physical and environmental assault, showing vulnerability in this situation.
Reacts to pain and disorientation upon awakening in the lab but begins to regain awareness and focus, indicating strong survival instinct and recovery ability.
After awakening confused and groggy, asks questions calmly and accepts help without hostility.
Shows trust by revealing the dog tags and engaging with Xavier about his identity.
Remains passive and cooperative during invasive medical examination without resistance or complaint.
Looks groggy and confused, asks basic questions indicating disorientation about his surroundings and identity.
Remains calm enough while being examined and having his claws and body tested repeatedly without panic or resistance.
Responds with dry humor—'Well, there's always tomorrow'—showing some mental resilience and confidence despite confusion.
Remains calm and unperturbed when high-tech attempts to damage his claws fail completely, indicating inner confidence and resilience.
Stays mostly silent and detached in the scene, with no direct intervention or explanation about his claws or skeleton despite being the focus of investigation.
Recoils and brushes away spoon with food from Beast; then accepts tray and feeds himself.
Plays along lightly with Beast and Jean's teasing about vegetables levitating; concedes with a nod.
Feeds himself despite weakness; shows signs of recovering and engaging actively with others.
Rejects Beast's initial attempt to feed him, asserting some independence.
Engages in light teasing banter with teammates, showing social awareness and confidence.
Concedes and nods when asked to wear his lunch, showing cooperation.
Becomes agitated and defensive when questioned about his past and identity.
Jokes about not needing answers and requests pants, showing some humor and lightheartedness.
Expresses distrust and distance by pulling away when Xavier points to his dogtags and avoids answering questions.
Responds with sarcastic humor about 'Magneto' and wishing for simpler names, indicating a guarded but friendly tone.
Becomes agitated and repeatedly claims not to know basic information about himself or surroundings.
Pulls away when asked about sensitive information (adamantium in body, military connection).
Responds sarcastically and humorously to uncertain situation ('I don't need any of my questions answered and you get me some pants').
Demonstrates heightened senses by hearing conversations from the other side of the door wall.
Responds to Xavier's offer of a tour with humor and light-heartedness ('Delighted. Now can I please have some pants?')
Shows discomfort and restlessness on school grounds, looking around anxiously
Mocks Cyclops and Storm in a playful manner ('I'm gonna guess they call you.......')
Overhears conversation through a wall, demonstrating acute senses and awareness.
Expresses impatience and discomfort in the new environment, showing lack of ease and possibly poor social adaptability.
Mocks others by guessing their names, showing confidence and social awareness but in a cheeky manner.
States simply 'I am a boxer guy' when asked about himself, indicating straightforwardness but little elaboration or insight that might be valued in this context.
Mocks others with teasing nicknames (The Uncanny Guava-man and Flipper Boy).
Shows some openness when admitting he has been open 'once or twice'.
Responds seriously when Xavier points out his pain and defensive humor.
Expresses skepticism about people's offers to help.
Mocks others and uses humor as a defense mechanism.
Expresses disbelief at being found, claiming he would have known.
Shows skepticism about others' intentions but maintains attention and seriousness when prompted.
Reacts guardedly but with some openness to dialogue when confronted about his pain.
Fails to notice a child stretching an extraordinary leg on the soccer field, missing unusual details.
Rejects help from Xavier, expresses desire to remain isolated and alone, refuses connection.
Expresses distrust and anger towards Xavier’s attempts to probe into his pain and past.
Acknowledges the harsh reality of the outside world and its tendency to divide people, showing some awareness of others’ struggles.
Expresses concern about the dangerous world the kids will face, implying a protective attitude.
Invites Xavier to lunch despite being in pain, showing friendliness and openness.
Looks down the path and says 'You can come out now' before leaving, possibly encouraging honesty or sincerity.
Walks slow, energy gone, holding his side in agony after a confrontation with an enemy. Breathing heavy.
Engages the opponent but suffers visible internal injury ('that thing tore up my insides'), shows resilience by continuing despite pain.
Recognizes the danger and emotional reality about preparing kids for the real world, speaks candidly and insightfully about consequences.
Looks with loneliness and jealousy at Jean and Cyclops sharing a tender moment, then turns away to observe Rogue eating alone who hides her face from him.
Nods in acknowledgement when Xavier mentions the fear and prejudice mutants face, showing understanding and empathy for the outsider experience.
Laughs in response to Xavier's offer of protection and to stay, possibly masking deeper feelings, but overall open to staying with the group.
Acknowledges danger and the threat of Sabertooth realistically and without denial.
Knows he must recover and consider staying to learn control, showing awareness and openness to guidance.
His expression shows loneliness and jealousy but remains composed and focused, indicating emotional control in social settings.
Does not act out impulsively despite obvious emotional undercurrents and threats.
Laughs off protection promise, possibly indicating some skepticism or self-reliance but also a confident attitude.
Shows concern for safety by reassuring 'As long as you're with me, you'll be safe.'
Is speechless and respectful in the presence of Xavier's demonstration of mental power, showing humility.
Watches others train in the Danger Room with interest, seemingly supportive.
Looks around the room, notices every child is frozen in time, and is speechless at Xavier's mental display.
Watches Cyclops train in the Danger Room and considers trying it himself to build strength.
Compliments Cyclops with 'Nice... eye.' after Cyclops saves him from a projectile.
Accepts challenge to enter the danger room willingly and confidently.
Calmly assesses danger room surroundings and confidently engages with the challenges without hesitation.
Successfully evades and neutralizes multiple incoming threats using claws with skill and precision.
Smiles at control room after dodging an attack, demonstrating confidence and calm under pressure.
Explodes into a berserker rage, attacking indiscriminately including himself and others, creating fear among teammates.
Stops his attack suddenly, retracts claws, and allows Jean to approach despite his feral state.
Enters a berserker rage, attacking wildly and causing collateral damage, including self-harm.
Eventually retracts claws and attempts to regain control after the rampage.
Resists hurting Jean despite initial aggression, retracts claws reluctantly when she approaches, and allows her to help him when exhausted.
Raises his claws to protect himself when feeling threatened.
Struggles as if unable to control his own body but ultimately restrains himself by retracting claws, avoiding harm to Jean.
Expresses doubt about belonging and shows emotional vulnerability ('This is not where I am supposed to be'), indicating some internal conflict.
Lays in bed sweating, eyes darting rapidly during REM sleep, indicating internal turmoil but no direct action or control.
Struggles weakly against restraints in a laboratory setting, showing limited ability to free himself or take control.
Instinctively attacks to defend himself upon waking up in pain and panic, then shows tenderness in a brief, frail moment with Rogue.
Allows Rogue to touch his face, sharing a moment of vulnerability and fragile connection despite immense suffering.
Claws extended in aggression causing harm to Rogue initially, indicating defensive aggression rather than warmth.
Reacts instantly upon awakening to the looming figure by extending claws defensively, demonstrating alertness and quick reflexes.
Sits upright despite severe trauma—incisions and being restrained—showing physical resilience and mental toughness.
His uncontrolled claws momentarily harm Rogue, indicating a loss of control in a critical moment.
Changes from defensive posture to retract claws and allow Rogue to touch him, showing self-awareness and control in a tense emotional moment.
Begins to tremble and howl in pain uncontrollably, revealing vulnerability and a possible inability to manage intense internal suffering.
Sits with his head in his hands after Rogue’s outburst and transformation.
Shrugs indifferently when told Sabertooth was sent to find him, shows little emotional engagement.
Sits sullenly with head hung during conversation with Xavier, indicating withdrawal rather than openness.
Shrugs when informed about Magneto sending Sabertooth to find him, showing limited engagement or concern.
Inquires about what happened to him after the encounter, showing awareness and desire to understand his situation.
States ignorance about Magneto despite his notoriety, indicating a gap in knowledge.
Admits vulnerability about aging and fear of death in front of Rogue.
Expresses reluctant attachment and concern for Rogue despite initial rejection.
Responds defensively and resists help from Xavier despite the risks he faces, showing reluctance but some self-awareness.
Expresses deep emotional insight about his own mortality and the impact of Rogue's touch, showing reflective and realistic understanding of his situation.
Thanks a woman sincerely, allowing a tender embrace and gently reciprocating it.
Comforts and thanks someone sincerely, showing emotional presence and control.
Jokes about 'naughty' thoughts with Jean Grey, showing a lighter, more approachable side.
Criticizes the decision to let Rogue leave unsupervised, indicating frustration with others' choices but showing concern indirectly.
Participates in a training session wearing specialized suit and follows instructions with some controlled irritation; claws accidentally tear through gloves indicating lack of carefulness.
Responds with humorous deflection when asked to concentrate, demonstrating confidence but lack of serious focus.
Expresses frustration at others' passive approach with a critical remark, showing awareness and assertiveness about taking responsibility.
Calls others hypocrites and insults Beast as 'Boo-Berry,' escalating conflict with Cyclops.
Holds back violence just at the moment Cyclops lunges at him with claws extended.
Extends claws quickly to defend himself and stops Cyclops from attacking, showing readiness and control in a tense situation.
Engages in verbal confrontation but remains assertive and clear in calling out hypocrisy and unfairness, displaying confidence and presence of mind.
Logan is going through a light routine in the Danger Room with Beast at the controls, indicating training and preparedness.
Xavier instructs Beast to stay with Logan and not to leave the school, implying trust in Logan's abilities in a critical moment.
Expresses concern about Rogue's wellbeing after the incident.
Invites Rogue to go out for a drink and continue their conversation.
Hides his true feelings despite sensing something is wrong with Rogue.
Makes a teasing comment about women smelling different, displaying playful friendliness.
Finishes exercise in the danger room despite pain and stiffness, demonstrating physical capability and perseverance.
Notices subtle cues that something is wrong but chooses to hide his knowledge, showing situational awareness and emotional control.
Attempts to invite Rogue out to drink and engage her in conversation, demonstrating social awareness and initiative.
Wrestles with how to remove his uniform after exercise, possibly indicating a minor practical awkwardness.
Chases Rogue aggressively, claws tearing through walls.
Gets clotheslined and thrown down the hall by Beast, struggling despite his resilience.
Attempts to signal peace by retracting claws amid fight with Beast.
Fails to de-escalate the conflict despite retreating and explaining himself.
Flashes his claws reluctantly, showing restraint despite anger.
Urgently tries to convince Beast not to attack by giving useful information.
Calls Beast a 'moron' in frustration.
Ignores Rogue by passing her brusquely as if she were not there.
Pursues Rogue aggressively, roaring and ready to attack.
Leaps and physically restrains Mystique, pressing claws to her throat to get information.
Leaps across the room and grabs Mystique by the throat, extending claws only enough to draw blood and holding her fast to interrogate her.
Thinks for a minute before turning Mystique around and proceeding cautiously toward Magneto's voice.
Extends claws menacingly to protect Jean Grey from Magneto's threat.
Steps back frustrated after Beast lets go of Mystique under threat.
Extends claws menacingly very close to Magneto's eyes, showing readiness and confidence in a high-stakes situation.
Steps back frustrated after Beast lets go, seeming unable to immediately control the metal threat.
Defeatedly complies with Magneto's demand and steps into the Iron Lady device to avoid harm to others, despite personal agony.
Attempts to seize the opportunity to move for Magneto when Jean uses her power to lift the metal, demonstrating readiness to act quickly.
Turns and steps inside the Iron Lady after being defeated and agonized, showing acceptance of the situation but lack of ability to resist or escape.
Gave himself up to save someone else (implied from Beast's comment).
Glares defiantly at enemies, spits at Magneto.
Remains defiant and glares at his captors despite being tightly restrained and unable to struggle.
Spits at Magneto showing contempt and fearlessness even in captivity.
Mentioned indirectly as a mutant possibly affected by the device, no direct action or commentary on skill or behavior.
Subject of scientific analysis showing enhanced metabolism and cell production, but no direct action by Logan shown here.
Instinctively struggles to get free when trapped, showing survival instincts despite pain.
Is captured and immobilized in a small box with only his head out, indicating vulnerability and being outsmarted or caught unaware.
Shakes his head to affirm he wants to know his true identity despite the pain.
Struggles and wails in pain from the spikes inside the box.
Demands Magneto to show some courtesy by telling him what he is dying for.
Shakes his head in response to Magneto's ambiguous answers but accepts the unknown with a resigned 'Of course.'
Struggles in vain as his blood flows from spikes inside the box, showing physical endurance but inability to break free.
Confronts Magneto directly by demanding to know what he is dying for.
Engages Magneto in a sharp, insightful dialogue, accurately reading his motivations and anticipating his emotional state.
Demonstrates confidence and control in conversation, never losing composure despite Magneto's provocations.
Does not take direct physical action in this excerpt, relying on verbal engagement alone.
Recognizes the device from his dreams, indicating awareness and connection to the technology.
Screams in horror, reaching the brink of madness upon being trapped inside the device.
Frees himself from the device by popping his claws through his own chest, tearing through the lock to escape.
Enters a berserker rage and tears through the shell of the torch despite being mortally wounded.
Engages Magneto directly, maintaining a stalemate despite Magneto's powerful magnetic abilities.
Fights Sabertooth fiercely, sustaining a prolonged brutal fight and continuing to fight despite near exhaustion and severe injury.
Is unexpectedly grabbed and thrown by Sabertooth, losing positional advantage and falling from the torch.
Successfully pounds Sabertooth into unconsciousness despite severe injury and exhaustion.
Retracts claws at the last moment instead of delivering the killing blow, showing control and restraint.
Collapses and rolls away after fight, relying on healing factor to recover.
Looks up but cannot move, hand merely twitches, claws extending a few inches showing restrained impulse to act amid danger
Looks up but is unable to move, only his hand twitches with claws extending a few inches, indicating physical or mental incapacity in a critical moment.
Arrives injured but is welcomed warmly by others who smile and laugh; he looks awkward but engages in light-hearted naming of himself as 'Wolverine'.
Emerges from injury wearing a carefully designed uniform that accommodates his abilities (gloves with reinforced holes for claws).
Appears awkward despite positive reception from teammates when showing off his new uniform.
